topic.title: How to have an untrackable VPN
topic.body:
I've been wondering of how to have a really safe VPN without anyone knowing your location, even the provider.

I was thinking of dedicated servers or cloud computing but I don't know how trustworthy are those, and those paid services like cyberghost, tunnelbear and whatnot aren't that ok to me.

I was also thinking of getting a computer acting like a VPN server on another physical location, but I don't know how to hide that I'm connected to that server.

1584836844_1EVRj1cizACuJXsBGLRGSvTMYG7Mk.body:
> [z0net](#comment_32_1KpsEG8BKkSJPFv8VVbngfC7xToMrYDJfS): Some VPN providers don't keep any logs in the first place so they don't have anything to be subpoenaedCheck out IPVanish.You can also tunnel traffic through Tor or I2p, which of course is free

I kinda don't understand i2p but I'll research more, thanks
